metadata.title: USN-4897-2 -- Pygments vulnerabilities
metadata.description: USN-4897-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Pygments. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Ben Caller discovered that Pygments incorrectly handled parsing certain  files. If a user or automated system were tricked into parsing a specially  crafted file, a remote attacker could cause Pygments to hang or consume  resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2021-27291)   It was discovered that Pygments incorrectly handled parsing certain  files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of  service. (CVE-2021-20270)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4897-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  python3-pygments - 1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm1 python-pygments - 1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
